frame.name: Make_compromise
frame.definition:
<def-root>Two (or more) people (the <fen>Parties</fen>, also encodable as <fen>Party_1</fen> and <fen>Party_2</fen>) come to an agreement committing them to carrying out an <fen>Obligation</fen>. The agreement is construed as non-ideal for both parties but necessary to end a dispute. The process is understood to be symmetrical or reciprocal. Instead of a specific mention of the <fen>Obligation</fen>, a <fen>Topic</fen> expression may be used to indicate the domain covered.
<ex>No <fex name="Topic">arms</fex> <t>compromise</t> <fex name="Parties">between the two parties</fex> is expected before the end of 2012.</ex>
<ex>So <fex name="Party_1">you</fex>'ll <t>compromise</t> <fex name="Party_2">with us</fex> <fex name="Obligation">to continue the project for at least another year</fex>?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Party_1
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e., agentive) party to the compromise, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus <fen>Manner</fen> is construed to be that of <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.
<ex>On Monday, <fex name="par1">the airline</fex> <t>compromised</t> with the Canadian Auto Workers. on a contract for salary and benefits.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Party_2
FE.definition:
<def-root>The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or group of participants) in the compromise. It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by <m>with</m>).
<ex>Parenthetical Foundation has finally reached a <t>compromise</t> <fex name="par2">with The Bracket Fund</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Obligation
FE.definition:
<def-root>An expression of the commitment made by the <fen>Parties</fen> .
<ex>The US and Russia have <t>compromised</t> <fex name="obl">to share a portion of early warning data on missile launches</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered by the compromise.
<ex>They'll never <t>compromise</t> <fex name="Topic">on salary</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root>As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <fen>Medium</fen> of communication may be expressed. <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to record or negotiate the <fen>Obligation</fen>.
<ex>The parties entered into an <fex name="med">oral</fex> <t>compromise</t> to arbitrate disputes arising in connection with the contract.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the act of making an agreement which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of either <fen>Party_1</fen> or <fen>Parties</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>I <fex name="man">readily</fex> <t>compromised</t> with her to end our wrestling match.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Parties
FE.definition:
<def-root>The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in reaching a compromise.
<ex><fex name="pars">The US and Russia</fex> have <t>compromised</t> on a plan to destroy surplus portable anti-aircraft missiles.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the compromise occurs.
<ex>The town coucil members reached a <t>compromise</t> <fex name="Place">at the City Hall plenary session</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the compromise occurs.
<ex>The town coucil members finally reached a <t>compromise</t> <fex name="Place">at midnight</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE describes a characteristic of the <fen>Obligation</fen>, <fen>Party_1</fen>, or <fen>Parties</fen>.
<ex>They <t>compromised</t>, <fex name="Descriptor">unaware that we would have given in to any of their demands had the simply kept at it for another week</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Parties</fen> make the compromise.\
<ex>We're making <t>compromises</t> <fex name="pur">to head off potentially larger conflicts down the road</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: compromise.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: reach an agreement by conceding items of interest.

lexUnit.name: compromise.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an agreement reached by both parties conceding some number of points.

lexUnit.name: meet half-way.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: come to an agreement by mutual concession.
